title: Assistant Professor
biography: Tianyin Xu is an Assistant Professor in the Department of Computer Science at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign. His research focuses on making computer systems reliable and secure, especially those operating at the cloud and datacenter scale. He is also interested in software engineering, particularly in the areas of configuration management and testing.
researchStatement: My research goal is to make computer systems reliable and secure, especially those operating at the cloud and datacenter scale. I am working on the Acto project, which aims to develop automatic end-to-end testing for large-scale cloud systems. The project has been recognized with several awards, including the 2024 Dean’s Award for Excellence in Research for Assistant Professor. I have also published several papers in top-tier conferences, including SOSP '23. I am committed to teaching and mentoring students, and have taught several courses, including Operating Systems Design, Advanced Operating Systems, and Distributed Systems Seminar.
